alert.note: Alert for Del Norte Vicinity, Northern San Luis Valley Below 8500 Ft; Eastern San Juan Mountains Above 10000 Ft; Upper Rio Grande Valley, Eastern San Juan Mountains Below 10000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Avalanche Watch issued March 15 at 5:42PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: THE FOLLOWING MESSAGE IS TRANSMITTED AT THE REQUEST OF THE COLORADO AVALANCHE INFORMATION CENTER. …AVALANCHE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 530 PM WEDNESDAY UNTIL 430 PM THURSDAY… *WHAT… A potent winter storm is impacting the area creating dangerous avalance conditions. Expect the avalanche danger to rise to HIGH (Level 4 of 5) by Thursday night. *WHERE… Sangre de Cristo Mountains, the Southeast San Juan Mountains, including areas around Wolf Creek Pass, Cumbres, and La Manga Passes. *WHEN… Expect dangerous avalanche conditions to begin on Wednesday night and last through Friday at 4:30 PM. *IMPACTS… Heavy snow and strong winds will create dangerous avalanche conditions. Large and dangerous avalanches will be easy to trigger once the new snow accumulates. Avalanches will run naturally. Gibson
